overview.summary: Zero-Trust Spectrum (Files) defines six assurance levels (ZS-1 â†’ ZS-6) for file handling inside zero-trust architectures, aligned with NIST SP-800-207, UK NCSC Zero-Trust Architecture, and CyBOK.

zs_levels.label: Pass-through
zs_levels.description: Files accepted without verification; basic metadata/access checks only.

zs_levels.label: Detection
zs_levels.description: Signature/hash/pattern recognition detects known threats but cannot assure safety.

zs_levels.label: Isolation / Flattening
zs_levels.description: Executes or renders files in controlled environments to prevent direct interaction.

zs_levels.label: Sanitisation (DDR)
zs_levels.description: Strips or copies only allow-listed elements, removing macros, scripts, links, active content.

zs_levels.label: Transform
zs_levels.description: Parses and reconstructs files to conform to safe models; removes unsafe components via software rebuild.

zs_levels.label: Deterministic Rebuild
zs_levels.mechanism: Clean intermediary model; no source bytes retained
zs_levels.description: Files fully deconstructed and rebuilt from specification; output validated to spec with audit evidence; supports neutral flat-file export/import.

classification_criteria.evidence_expectations: Above ZS-4 requires conformance testing, proof of no source-byte persistence, policy enforcement traceability, validation/verification steps, and reproducible audit trails.

decision_quick_picks.notes: Deterministic outputs plus audit trail; flat-file handoffs supported.
Sensitive content requires evidencing and document fidelity.
Deterministic rebuild preserves usability; ZS-3 only for non-rebuildable binaries/archives.
Unknown binaries/installers default to ZS-3 isolation; tier by MIME/size/source reputation.
Transfer path uses deterministic rebuild + reporting; review path via ZS-3 preview.
Flat-file export mode maintains governance metadata separate from originals.
Require flat-file interchange (XML/JSON schema) for analytics, ETL, SIEM/DLP ingestion.
Docs/packages rebuilt; executables isolated alongside repo/code-sign controls.

flat_file_position: Flat-file export/import (CSV, XML, JSON, TXT, PDF/A) is an essential control boundary for deterministic separation between untrusted sources and clean destinations. ZS-6 implementations typically support neutral exports for cross-domain transfer, archival, and deterministic re-ingestion.
implementation_notes: ZS-6 mechanisms perform deterministic rebuild from a clean intermediary model, retaining no source data and verifying outputs against specification; adopted in defense, intelligence, and high-assurance domains requiring provable zero-trust enforcement.

glossary.CDR: Content Disarm & Reconstruction; deterministic extraction/rebuild to remove risk.
glossary.Flat-file export: Neutral format outputs used for cross-domain transfer/archival.
glossary.Deterministic rebuild: ZS-6 capability where files are reconstructed from clean intermediary models with spec validation.
